newsitem.title: BULGARIA: High demand prevents fall in Bulgaria depo rates.
newsitem.headline: High demand prevents fall in Bulgaria depo rates.

text.p: Demand for interbank deposits topped supply on the Bulgarian money market and depo rates were flat from Thursday despite a central bank decision to cut its main interest rate, dealers said.
"Rates stood flat as banks actively bid for funds on their own behalf and on behalf of clients to meet tax and salary payments due by end-month and end-quarter," said a bank dealer.
Overnight interbank depo rates were flat from Thursday's 11-12 percent annually while deposits for up to seven days were borrowed at an annual interest of 15-16 percent, also unchanged.

Traders expected depo rates to fall next week if demand for funds subsided to adjust to a cut in the central bank main interest rate to 10.12 percent simple annual or an effective annual 10.60 percent, to take effect on Monday.
The main interest rate is now set at an effective annual 16.30 percent.
The average annual interbank deposit rate was 13.71 percent on Thursday against 15.10 percent on Wednesday, a central bank official said. -- Dessislava Popova, Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 91188
